metadata.title: CVE-2022-24917 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
An authenticated user can create a link with reflected Javascript codeinside it for servicesâ€™ page and send it to other users. The payload can beexecuted only with a known CSRF token value of the victim, which is changedperiodically and is difficult to predict. Malicious code has access to allthe same objects as the rest of the web page and can make arbitrarymodifications to the contents of the page being displayed to a victimduring social engineering attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24917` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-agent2 - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-web-service - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:6.0.29+dfsg-1').
